episodes.title: Pt. 3 Life after Prison as a Jehovah’s Witness #jehovahswitnesses #marriage #exjw
episodes.description:
Welcome back! In this video we go back to how things went after prison. Marriage, appointment as Ministerial Servant, Disfellowshipped and having children. A roller coaster indeed. 

Thank you for taking time to listen and if anything resonates with you feel free to comment. 

For my video on my biggest reason for leaving check this link out: https://youtu.be/6igczFuMAt4?si=0TqCHU219q1SM02Y
 
To checkout part 2: https://youtu.be/AIzpFrKy30c?si=WiPqXLCZSjNu4Blc

To watch part 1: https://youtu.be/FjlxFko8ADI?si=jlAxQ0E7PhLo5mTo

For more information and history about Jehovah Witnesses check this site: jwfacts.com

#faith #exjw #jehovahswitnesses

episodes.title: Pt. 2 - Locked Up & Preaching: My Life as a Jehovahs Witness in Prison #exjw #jehovahswitnesses
episodes.description:
For almost ten years, I lived behind bars—but that didn’t stop me from preaching. As a devoted Jehovah’s Witness, I continued to share the religion’s teachings with fellow inmates, convinced I had the truth. Prison didn’t wake me up. I studied the information from Watchtower religiously! The indoctrination was so strong that even in one of the harshest environments, I remained loyal to the organization. After my release, I got married and continued as a Jehovah’s Witness—until I was disfellowshipped. And that was the moment everything started to change.

If you’re interested in Part 1: “Growing up as one of Jehovahs Witnesses” here’s the link: https://youtu.be/FjlxFko8ADI?si=vQb5T7R3JbgWyybU


Thanks for taking time to listen to my story and I hope it helps you in some way. See you on the next video.

#exjw #jehovahswitnesses #prison #indoctrination

episodes.title: Healing isn’t about erasing your past-it’s about taking back your power. #healing #exjw #trauma
Growing up as one of Jehovah’s Witnesses 🤪 #fieldservice #jehovahswitnesses #growingup
episodes.description:
In this video, I share my personal journey of growing up as one of Jehovah’s Witnesses—what it was like being raised in the religion, the teachings that shaped my life, and the challenges I faced along the way. From strict rules and expectations to the unique culture within the organization, I’ll give an honest perspective on the experiences that defined my childhood and early adulthood.

Whether you’re a former Jehovah’s Witness, someone curious about the religion, or just interested in personal stories of faith and transformation, this video offers an inside look at a world that many don’t fully understand.

Let me know your thoughts in the comments, and don’t forget to like, share, and subscribe for more content about my journey and insights into Jehovah’s Witnesses.

episodes.title: Are you believing Lies?!!
episodes.description:
Hey welcome back! 
In this video, I just want those who affiliated with Jehovahs witnesses to just ponder for a moment on WHY they believe the continuous lie that Armageddon is on the horizon. Or why so many changes to doctrines and beliefs that don’t make any sense. 
Ask yourself: Could this be a business being ran? 
Am I in this because of the people I’m close too? 
Do I really believe this so called paradise is really gonna come in my lifetime? 
Why so many changes? Are they just trying to keep members active?

Be objective. Use critical thinking skills. Be honest.

Like, comment and share please. 

Wake up!!!

episodes.title: My Biggest reasons for Leaving the cult of Jehovah witnesses #exjw #jehovahswitnesses #kingdomhall
episodes.description:
Take a journey with me as I start to share my experiences growing up as one of JW’s. In this brief video, I discuss a couple of the main reasons I decided that this organization is corrupt and dangerous to children. 

Forgive me for the abrupt ending. I am learning how to make videos, so please bear with me on the editing lol.

In future videos I’ll dive into my experiences and how JW’s has affected my life. 

Please comment below on your reasons for leaving and thank you for watching.
